etymologies: Middle English: from the frequent use, in Psalms 148–150, of the Latin imperative laudate! ‘praise ye!’ (see also laud)

definitions: a service of morning prayer in the Divine Office of the Western Christian Church, traditionally said or chanted at daybreak, though historically it was often held with matins on the previous night

examples.text: from the abbey church we could hear the faint chanting of lauds

shortDefinitions: service of morning prayer in Divine Office of Western Christian Church
